alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 3:54PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Brantley and southwestern Wayne Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 353 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Raybon, or 7 miles north of Nahunta, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Screven, Broadhurst and Hortense. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Georgia.
